result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rhonda K. Pfenning is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rhonda K. Pfenning was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Rhonda K. Pfenning was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs within the first three (3) years of probation.  
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt: DOC - Notice of Case Status Change Slip - Discharge - Early

Discharge Certificate.   Effective September 4, 2020, discharged from judgment only.
Civil rights restored:  1)Right to Vote.  2)Obligations for jury duty.
Civil rights not restored:  1)Firearms may not be used or possessed unless a pardon, which does not restrict possession of firearms, is received from the governer.  2)Public office can not be held unless a pardon is obtained from the governor.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's motion to return seized property.  Court inquires of any restitution order.  Both counsel confirm no restitution ordered.  Arguments by State.  Court grants motion, items to be returned.
Atty Steven Hughes appt'd.
Motion hearing on February 21, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Return of Property

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead to count 1 and 2, State will move to dismiss counts 3-6.  Court advises defendant of charges/max penalties, felony conviction prohibitions.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to Count 1 & 2.  PLQ/WR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea(s) and finds defendant guilty of counts 1 & 2, dismiss counts 3-6.  State recommends 5 years probation.  Defendant addresses the court.  Court withholds sentence & places defendant on 5 yrs. probation on both counts.  Condition:  provide a DNA sample; assess costs to be paid within the 1st 3 years of probation according to schedule set by PP; Advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State confirms for Atty Smith, no restitution.  Counsel requests another date to try to resolve the matter.  Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms counsel received the Information; advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, and constitutional rights.  NGP entered.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg. on record.  Court finds defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial.  DA to file Information.

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  WOPH on record.  Atty Smith to supplemental record with it in writing.  Arraignment scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smith requests another date, defedant continues to waive time limits.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  TLW for PH.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smith just received police reports, requests to come back on 6/7.  Any conditions of bond previously set are continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Atty Gary Smith appt'd.

Defendant qualifies for Public Defender, waives time limits for PH.  No bond requested, no bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Court inquires if defendant wishes to speak to the SPD Atty.  Defendant informs court she has contacted an attorney, was informed to plead not guilty today.  Court informs defendant can't take plea today.  Defendant agrees not to schedule PH at this time, waives time limits for PH.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
